title: Flipped Learning-Based Psychology Lecture Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic psychological theories and pedagogical concepts
context.additional_context: Educational Psychology for Secondary Education: Blended Learning Environment Utilizing Personal Devices (BYOD) for Pre-service/In-service Teachers

learning_goals: Learners can explain core components of the flipped learning model (pre-learning materials, activity-based classes) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners demonstrate the ability to apply core psychology concepts (cognitive development, learning theories, etc.) to real classroom cases through group discussions with peer teachers.
Learners can participate in over 90% of role-playing activities conducted in classrooms based on theories acquired through pre-learning videos and quizzes.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
